definition[0]: a feeling of great sadness that you have when someone you love dies or when something is taken from you
example[0]: Running the business helped to fill the void after his wife died.
definition[1]: a situation in which something important or interesting is needed or wanted, but does not exist
example[1]: The amusement park will fill a void in this town, which has little entertainment for children.
definition[2]: an empty area of space where nothing exists
example[2]: She looked over the cliff into the void.
definition[3]: a contract or official agreement that is void is not legal and has no effect
definition[4]: to make a contract or agreement void so that it has no legal effect
definition[5]: a contract or agreement that is void has no legal effect because it is against the law
example[3]: Under state law, a contract to pay money knowingly lent for gambling is void.
